channel.title: Registration for my website - HELP!
channel.description:
Okay, so my major question is.. Where can I find a tutorial on.. This is hard to explain but.. Hopefully you'll get what I'm after because I've searched all through these forums and google and I have no idea what it would be called in a topic, so that doesn't help.. Sorry if there's already a topic on this, if there is.. please link me to it. So.. when someone registers on a runescape private server website, it creates their account in-game and it's with the same username and password. How would I go about doing this? I know it involves MySQL and PHP, but is there any tutorials? Thanks if anyone helps and rep++ to those who help.
Kind regards, Skiller8860

item.title: Registration for my website - HELP!
item.dc:creator: @skiller8860 skiller8860
item.description:
@skiller8860 wrote:

I didn’t understand anything either one of you said. Unfortunately I’m new to PHP and MySQL :L. Awesome at coding RsPs’s… just websites I’m a little iffy on.

Read full topic

item.title: Registration for my website - HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Mikau Mikau
item.description:
@Mikau wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:2, topic:462113”]Make your server load, save and update players from a database. Make a PHP write usernames and passwords to that same database.[/quote]Would be the best way.

You could always look up PHP file IO and just get it to create a text or binary file and have your server load these. Though if you want to do more than register accounts, such as high-scores or account editing you’d have to go with MySQL.

Read full topic

item.title: Registration for my website - HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Make your server load, save and update players from a database. Make a PHP write usernames and passwords to that same database.

Read full topic
